Author: axod
Content:
Better for the webmaster perhaps :/

Google Analytics is cool, but it slows down page loads something shocking.

With more complex measurement, comes a worse experience for your users...

Sorry, I don't want it :/

Author: paulsb
Content: Out of all of the "ones to watch", I only liked videojug (although the site does look a bit messy); the others, meh. I am sure - and hope - they will all be successful, but where are the UK companies that really push the envelope and do something truly innovative?

Author: jgrahamc
Content:
Don't do that.

If the community wants everything from a particular site submitted then let's ask PG to scrape their RSS feed.

I'm sometimes tempted to post everything from my blog, but I look at things and decide whether I think the community here will be interested: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=150865

Author: Tichy
Content:
"And they will tell all their friends about it - whether they like it or not."

LOL, especially the "whether they like it or not" part is so true ;-) I still think it is mostly cognitive dissonance ("I paid so much for this stuff, it has to be good or I'll look like an idiot").

Author: bkrausz
Content:
I'm not experimenting so much as trying to provide a beneficial service (at 6am the differences blur significantly though).

I'd say around 25% of xkcd's are remotely relevant to this site, the question is whether or not an automated source of 1:3 signal/noise ratio is worth it.

Author: andyn
Content:
They had an earlier article covering the Apple fall:

http://www.computerworld.com/action/article.do?command=viewA...

I assumed this Vista one was just a continuation rather than a "VISTA HACKED (oh by the way the mac went too)".

Author: brk
Content:
My MB consistently gets a wifi signal in an office building where all the Lenovos seem to need an Ethernet tether once they get 6 inches away from the prime areas.

Not sure what display problems you refer to (honestly curious), both my MBP and MB seem to have displays as good as any other laptop. My other hobby is digital photography (Canon EOS5D, L glass, etc.), so I'm working with Aperture or Photoshop a lot, the only "display" issues I'd note is that the laptop LCDs don't calibrate as nicely as my external Apple cinema displays.

Author: uuilly
Content: This is often true.  I downloaded a simple world border set from NGA and it took days of cleaning.  It's about the only part of my code that's commented b/c it took a mess of code to clean up a mess of data.  But still, cost effective or not, I would rather clean it myself than buy it.

Author: stener
Content:
yes and that brings me to other professions as in the film industry. E.g. this year the Academy Award for best Music (Song) was won by movie Once, which on technical and execution side looks amateurish compared to Hollywood blockbusters. In this case, the idea won Oscar.

I think to compare different kind of artist and their craft among themselves is valid.

Author: rms
Content:
If woopra does everything google analytics does in real time for free, I'll switch. It's annoying to have to wait until 3AM to check my stats.

I really liked http://www.webtrends.com/ back in the days of the bubble, but they've been pay software for a while now. Is there any pay software for analyzing server logs that's worth getting? The free/open source ones are missing lots of functionality.

Author: dcurtis
Content:
This is absolutely amazing. I thought Google Analytics was cool, but this looks like it's better.

Anyone know of any other alternatives?
